column3: Nice. utACK.\ntiny nit: don't label rpcblockchain.cpp changes (help output) as [test]. Maybe better open a 2nd PR.\n
@jonasschnelli good point, thanks. I've changed the PR title to reflect this.\n
utACK ~~modulo question~~\n
talked with @morcos out-of-band, sounds as though he's cool with changes as they are.\n
utACK modulo wording\n
ping on this\n
I'll start reviewing again after new year.\n
utACK\n
hexadecimal\n
fixed\n

What about "Expected number of hashes required to produce the current chain"?

Current wording could be read as "do that work, will get the current chain", which is a bit unlikely. :)
sure thing. fixed\n

I think you want:

```
    elif not re.match('[abcdef0-9]+$', string):
```
Very true :). willfix\n
fixed\n
It's the expected number of hashes up to _this point_ in the chain, not the entire chain. AFAIK  \n
I added a similar line for getblock at #7232\n

This message is based on [@sipa's description of chainwork](https://bitcoin.stackexchange.com/questions/26869/what-is-chainwork) and [was vetted previously by @petertodd](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7194#discussion_r47325775). You may want to close the PR you reference above; it was opened after this one and doesn't include tests.\n

Ok, I disagree that it's clear, but if everyone else is fine with it I can conform as well.

Regardless, my pull is not covered here, so not sure why would I close it?  

edit: My title wasn't clear, so I added the specific rpc.
